history.content:
1. They should all be out by mid-October. You should start applying right when they come out.

2. The earlier the better. You can pretty much ignore the hard deadlines set by companies. 

3. Not at all. You can interview again for a FT role, and typically it's about the same difficulty/a little more difficult than intern interviews.

4. About a month after applying. The coding challenge comes first. Once you ace that, your recruiter would set a phone screen followed by a round of behavioral/technical interviews.

5. Some companies like system design too. I personally am yet to face any system design questions in an interview.

6. Mediums can be hard and intimadating. Facebook and Google both ask mediums, and they are fairly hard to crack in an interview-like setting. 

7. Imo, put Sp2022 - almost all companies this fall would be recruiting for juniors.

I’m a rising junior interning at a middle sized company. I plan to graduate early and enter this middle sized company if I can’t get a FLAG internship this summer, and not if otherwise. My question is:

1. When are FLAG summer internships usually released? When do people generally apply FLAG summer internship? Like which months? I know it’s usually Fall.

2. If there’s a relatively long window, should I apply earlier or later? Is it the earlier the better?

3. if I don’t get a FLAG internship in junior summer, will my chances for a full time after graduation significantly decrease? (If so I’ll just graduate early then get into this middle sized company I’m interning in)

 

4. When is the expected time to get an interview after sending the application? How long are they gonna give you to prepare? (Assuming they offer an interview)

5. Except for LC-like questions and behavioral questions, are there gonna be other things in those interviews? If so, how to prepare?

6. How hard are these LC questions? I've heard internship questions are easier than full time new grad questions, and are in the easy-medium range.

7. When I apply for FLAG internships, is it better to put expected graduation Sp2022 or Sp2021 on my resume? I saw a post saying Sp2021 would be better

thanks a lot for answering these really basic questions!! I'm sure many rising juniors have the same concern, so if anyone who experienced it can answer, it would help a lot of people
history.subject: Is there any advantage to applying FLAG internship earlier or later?
